lines.text: You are most insolent, Mr. Andrews.
I want a pack of American cigarettes.
How much are they when you're all out?
How do you know I haven't got a gun?
Because your clothes fit you much too well.
It's plain to see you haven't got a gun either.
This is a lot worse than the old days of Prohibition. Not everybody drank, but everybody eats.
If I may say so, Mr. Ellis' sickness bears a curious relationship to whiskey.
Is anybody around here the umpire? Well, I can't say that I blame you. If it's all right with both sides, I'll call 'em as I see 'em.
Thank you. We have the utmost confidence in your judgment as the arbitrator, sir.
It's plain you didn't play in Brooklyn.
Nice girls aren't supposed to talk to me much less be seen with me.
